channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Traffic light facing shakespeare road - sensor needs checking ?, 28th April
item.description:
The Traffic light facing shakespeare road (PE Way / Coll / Chelt) was stuck on red today (28/4). We were the 2nd vehicle, a local person told me to roll forward a little to catch the sensor, which we did, and shortly afterwards the light changed. The lead vehicle had opted to do a U turn. Is it possible to check the motion/weight sensitivity of the sensor please ? Thankyou !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princess Elizabeth Way, Benhall, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 28th April
item.description:
Customer has called in and has mentioned that last week large branch fall onto the garden, this is the 2nd time this has happened and is a bit worried about the tree. Can the tree be looked into please

item.title: Loose board/ plank on bridge, 28th April
item.description:
Loose board/ plank on bridge. Public rights of way map says it is Brockworth footpath 32, USRN : 40102746, Number : EBW32 Bridge is at the the top of the path that runs alongside the chicken farm.

item.title: No street lights, 28th April
item.description:
We continue to have no street lights. It has been at least 6 nights without street lights. Surely the problem should be a priority.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Pilley Crescent, Leckhampton, Cheltenham

item.title: Building waste left outside of house, 28th April
item.description:
Building waste has been left outside this residence, and people have reported seeing rats around it which isn't great. Needs to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18,20,22,24, Elmfield Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken bridge, 28th April
item.description:
Good morning, a resident has reported to me that the bridge crossing the stream at this point is damaged. I have copied and pasted what he put in his message below. "Sorry to inform you that the first bridge across the brook has been damaged again . Two treads have been removed which are in the brook and the bridge is now quite dangerous." If you need any other information please do not hesitate to contact me. Many thanks Lianne
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
